abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Structural
            Adjustment Project for Colombia were as follows: the outcome
            was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The
            experience of Programmatic Labor Reform and Social
            Structural Adjustment Loan (PLaRSSAL I) implies the
            following main lessons that have been considered in the
            preparation of the PLaRSSAL II: Strong and sustained
            dialogue between the Government of Colombia (GOC) and the
            Bank through joint high-quality sector work on social
            protection issues and operations is valuable for future
            operations. Emphasis on outputs and outcomes, rather than
            inputs and processes, facilitates monitoring and following
            up of conditions by both the Government and the Bank. A
            series of operations - SECAL, PLaRSSAL I, and PLaRSSAL II -
            commits the Government to stay focused on monitoring
            progress in outputs of key reform measures over a longer
            time period in a coordinated, formal and systematic way.
            While the institutional reform is underway, constant
            collaboration between the GOC, the Bank, and other partners
            is crucial to developing the new platform upon which the
            health, education, and social reforms will rest.
